lines.text: Alright, listen up, people. Our fugitive has been on the run for ninety minutes. Average foot speed over uneven ground barring injuries is 4 miles-per-hour. That gives us a radius of six miles. What I want from each and every one of you is a hard-target search of every gas station, residence, warehouse, farmhouse, henhouse, outhouse and doghouse in that area. Checkpoints go up at fifteen miles. Your fugitive's name is Dr. Richard Kimble. Go get him.

[Holding Gerard at gunpoint]
I didn't kill my wife!
I don't care!
Newman, what are you doing?
I'm thinking.
Well, think me up a cup of coffee and a chocolate doughnut with some of those little sprinkles on top, while you're thinking.

This is hinky, this guy's a college graduate, he went to medical school, he's not gonna come through all the security, go to the county lockup, to find someone his one people say does not exist. Hinky.
Well, what does that mean Biggs, 'hinky'?
I don't know. Strange.
Weird.
Well, why don't you say strange or weird? I mean hinky, that has no meaning.
Well, we say hinky.
I don't want you guys using words around me that have no meaning. I'm taking the stairs and walking.

[sotto voice]
How about 'bullshit?' How about 'bullshit', Sam?
Sam, there's a guy on the phone claiming to be Richard Kimble.
[cast cackling in background that "another" Kimble is on the phone]
This is Gerard.
Do you remember what I told you in the tunnel?

[gesturing to his men to start tracing the call]
Um yeah... It was noisy... I think you said something like you didn't kill your wife.
Remember what you told me?
I remember you pointing my gun at me.
[Gerard's team gestures him not to antagonize Kimble and make the conversation stretch]
You said, "I don't care."

[whispering]
He's on the south side.

[to his team]
Yeah...
[then noticing Kimbles remake]
Yeah... that's right Richard... I don't care. I'm not trying to solve a puzzle here...
Well, I am trying to solve a puzzle.
Five seconds to location.
And I just found a big piece!
[slams down phone on desk so trace can continue]
If they can dye the river green today, why can't they dye it blue the other 364 days of the year?

[after taking credit for Kimble's saving of his partner and declaring all prisoners dead]
Oh. Wow. Gee Whiz. Looky here. You know we're always fascinated when we find leg irons with no legs in them. Who held the keys sir?
Me.
Where those keys at?
I don't know.
Care to revise your statement, sir?
What?
Do you want to change you bullshit story, sir?
[Poole shows guard a picture of Kimble]
He might have got out.
[last lines]
I thought you didn't care?
I don't.
[laughs]
Don't tell anybody, okay?
I don't want to tell you how to do your job...

[on his police radio]
Put the helicopter on the bridge!
...but only one man in a million can survive that fall. The guy is fish food.
Fine. Go get a cane pole, catch the fish that ate him.
Okay boys, gather around here and listen up. We're shuttin' it down, Wyatt Earp's here to mop up.
That's funny. "Wyatt Earp."

[after Kimble has just lept off the dam to escape]
What happened? Where'd he go?
The guy did a Peter Pan right off of this dam, right here.
What?
Yeah. BOOM.

[stunned]
Holy shit... Can we go home now...?

[flustered]
No...
That's my man!
Not anymore, he's not. He's going down. You don't help us, you stay the hell out!
Arrest us.

[sees Kimble in hospital hallway, disguised as a doctor]
Hey, Doc! We're looking for a prisoner from that bus-train wreck a couple of hours ago, might be hurt.
Uh, what does he look like?
6'1, 180, brown hair, brown eyes, beard. See anyone like that around?
Every time I look in the mirror, pal - except for the beard, of course!

[Kimble is confronting Nichols during the banquet]
Richard, I'm sorry, but I'm in the middle of this speech!
You almost got away with it, didn't you? I know all about it. I can prove it.

Ladies and gentlemen, my friend Richard Kimble doesn't feel... well, obviously. So, if you will just go on with your dessert and coffee, I'll be right back. Richard, would you mind to step aside, and we'll just... talk. Okay, so I'll be back in just a second...
[motions for Kimble to follow him outside]

[as they are walking out of the banquet hall]
You changed the samples, didn't you, huh? You switched the samples... after Lenz died! After Lenz died, you were the only one who had the access. You switched the samples, and the pathology reports.
[shoves Nichols]
Did you kill Lenz, too? Huh? Did you?

[turns to banquet crowd]
He falsified his research. So that RDU-90 could be approved and Devlin McGregor could give you... Provasic!
When I die, I wanna come back just like you.
Oh, you mean happy and handsome?
I may be crazy but that train sounds like an el.
St Louis doesn't have an elevated train.
How do you know it's an elevated train?
I think he's right, I lived under an el for 20 years.

Then you can explain the difference in the sound of an elevated train as opposed to a train that's running along the ground. You must have ears like a eagle, play that back, I wanna hear the sound of an elevated train.

[after Kimbles has just passed the stabbed bus prison guard who he saved]
Tell the attending he's got a puncture in the epigastric area.
How the hell could he tell that by looking at his face?
Now you listen. I don't give a damn which way you go, just don't follow me. You got that?
Yeah.
[as Copeland leaves]
Hey, Copeland. Be good.
Hey, Do you have a particular interest in our patient's X-Rays?
What do you mean?
I saw you looking at that boy's chest film.
It's a hobby of mine.
It's a hobby, really? What are your other hobbies - brain surgery?
How's the boy doing?
He saved his life.

Dr. Richard Kimble! There's no way out of here, Richard! The entire building is locked down! Give it up Richard, you don't have any time, Chicago police department thinks you're a cop killer, they WILL shoot you on sight!
[pauses]

Richard, I know you're innocent! I know about Frederick Sykes! I know about Dr. Charles Nichols! Richard, he borrowed your car the night of your wife's murder, he had your keys! No forced entry, Richard! He telephoned Sykes from your car, Richard! Richard, give it up! Richard, I'm either lying or I'm gonna shoot you, what do you think?
[another pause, as Nichols draws down on Gerard]
Give it up, Richard, it's time to stop running!
[to Sykes]
You missed your stop.
What ever happened with that thing about your wife?
It's not over yet.
All right, I want to start right there. We're going start with phone taps. I want to start with his lawyer first.
Whoa, whoa, whoa. You're never gonna get that.
You call Judge Reuben and tell him I want a whole bunch of phone taps...
Why are you yelling at me? Why?
And I'll call him later and tell him on who...
Why are you always yelling at me?
IF, I'm in a good mood.
Why don't you yell at her some time?

We were just informed by the U.S. Marshal's Office that Doctor Richard Kimble is alive and well and living in the city of Chicago. Now you all know in what high regard I hold the scumbag. So I am personally donating a bottle of twelve-year-old Scotch to whoever puts the collar on this quack.
Doctor Nichols, you really want to help him? You really want to be his friend? Then you'll help us bring him in, unharmed.
Why? So he can go back to prison? Tsk, tsk, tsk. If you want help, gentlemen, you've come to the wrong man. Richard is innocent and you'll never find him. He's too smart.

[sarcastically]
Oh well... we're pretty smart guys.
Yeah, what about us?
Last time I looked.
Yeah, we're smart. We are. I mean, how smart could he be, really? Is he as smart as you are?

[thinks and considers his answer, smiles]
Smarter.
You never give up, Richard, do you? You never give up!

[hitting him]
Why Helen?
Alright you guys, knock it off, there's nothing to see here and you come with me.
Excuse me
[to Richard]
thank you, I was just down to my last joke.
They killed my wife.
I know it Richard. But it's over.
[pauses and sighs]
You know I'm glad. I need the rest.
Sheriff Rawlins, with all due respect, I'd like to suggest check points on a 15 mile radius out here on I-57, I-24 and on route 13 out of Chester...
Whoa, whoa, whoa. The prisoners are all dead and the only thing checkpoints are gonna do is get a lot of good people frantic around here and flood my office with calls.

[deadpan]
Well, shit, sheriff, I'd hate to see that happen, so I guess I'll just take over your investigation.

[flustered]
You? On what authority?
Governor of the state of Illinois, United States Marshals Office, 5th District Northern Illinois.

[First lines, said when arriving at the scene of the train wreck]
My, my, my. What a mess.
[after Kimble jumps off of the dam]
Sam, are you out of your mind? He's dead.
That ought to make him easier to catch.
Newman, get rid of the helicopter!
Why?
'Cause I don't want to get shot!
So, financially, you're not going to be hurting after this, are you? I mean, she was worth quite a bit of money.

Are you suggesting that I killed my wife? Are you saying that I crushed her skull and that I shot her? How dare you! When I came home, there was a man in my house. I fought with this man. He had a mechanical arm. You find this man. You find this man.
If he came to me I would help him, but he wouldn't come to me. It's not his style.
How'd you lose that arm?
In the line of duty.

[stepping in the tunnel sewage]
Aw, shit! I just bought these shoes.
Shut up, Cosmo.
Henry, Dr. Nichols lied to me. Go find him.
[taking role]
Copeland.

[snappishly]
What?
Copeland, you be nice now.

[whispering]
I... don't... bargain.
[on the phone]
Well, Sir, Mr. Copeland was a bad man. He was gonna shoot one of my kids.
[pauses]
Well, sir, you can blame me, I'm the one that shot him.
So he showed up not dead yet. Let that be a lesson to you, boys and girls. Don't ever argue with the big dog, because the big dog is always right.
Woo-woo-woo-woof.

[Poole stumbles]
Poole, you gotta get some new boots.
I told you not to wear the heels.
And I want you to wear two coats.
Sure, next train wreck.
Why are we always mothering her?
'Cause she loves us.
CCH? What's that?
Cook County Hospital.

[listening to wiretap of Kimble talking with his lawyer]
Yeah, right there. What's he saying? Sounds like, 'Next... Stop'... Do that again!

[listening to tape replay]
'Next... stop... '
...Merchandise Mart.
Son of a bitch, our boy came home.
That bell! That bell is the bell on the Wells street bridge, it's six blocks away.
I knew that was an elevated train.
Oh yeah big dog, you're never wrong.
Sam!
What?
We just got a call from Harris Community Hospital. The wounded guard swears he saw Kimble outside the emergency room.
Well, that's hot.
And an ambulance is missing.
Where's he going in an ambulance?
Newman, we're gonna send you a bunch of cops, make sure they turn that place inside out.
You got it Sam.
And don't let them give you any shit about your pony tail.
I won't.
Well done young man.

[pleased that he has been recognised by Sam]
My pleasure Sam...
Look on your maps if you wanna know how to get there!
Your cousin still got his truck?
Uh huh.
Call him. Tell him we need it.
We got a gopher.
Why did Richard Kimble kill his wife?
He did it for the money.
What do you mean, he did it for the money? He's a doctor. He's already rich.
But she was more rich.
You better be straight with me kid. You're telling me this is the fella staying in your mother's basement?
That's what I'm telling you.
We're eating oranges and we're making IDs.
You guys have a problem?
No.
Uh, no, no problem at all.
Give it up. It's time to stop running.
What is this - a trench coat convention?
[on Kimble]
Does he have a reason to come after you?
Well, hell yeah I have a prosthetic arm. I must have murdered his wife right?

[while on the phone waiting outside CCH for Kimball]
Ooh, wait... I marked him.

[on Cosmo's police radio]
Attention all units. Transit police report officer down at Balbo Station. Kimble is suspect! Repeat; Officer Down!
What'd he do, shoot a cop?
Chicago PD will eat him alive!

[to helicopter]
As soon as you get a clean shot, you take him out.

[spots Kimble fighting Dr Nichols on the roof]
Richard. Stay where you are! This is the Chicago Police. Put your hands in the air. The building is totally secure.
[Richard runs down the stairs]
I repeat, do not move! Put your hands in the air!
[Richard continues to run]
I repeat, stay where you are!

[Studying Kimble's fake ID now in his possession]
Where are you Desmondo?

[taking fax]
Background just came in from Chicago.
About time! What do we got?
Uh, "Richard David Kimble, vascular surgeon... " what the hell is that?
Somebody that makes more money than you.
[first lines]
Come on Doc.
